edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.scheduler

Class WolfScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.scheduler.WolfScheduler

  • public class WolfScheduler
extends java.lang.Object
    creates a schedule from a catalog with a title
    Version:
    9/5/2018
    Author:
    William

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WolfScheduler(java.lang.String fileName)
      creates a new schedule object with catalog, empty schedule and title

    • Method Detail

      • getCourseFromCatalog

        public Course getCourseFromCatalog(java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String section)
        Checks to see if a course with a given name and section are in the catalog
        Parameters:
        name - the name of a course
        section - the section of a course
        Returns:
        the course if it is in the catalog

      • addCourse

        public boolean addCourse(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String section)
        Will add a course if it is not a duplicate and will return boolean whether or not the action can be performed. Will also not and a course if it overlaps with a different activity
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the course
        section - the section of the course
        Returns:
        boolean if a course can be added or not
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the course is already in schedule and if the time and days of an activity overlap with those of an activity already in the student's schedule

      • addEvent

        public boolean addEvent(java.lang.String title,
                        java.lang.String meetingDays,
                        int startTime,
                        int endTime,
                        int weeklyRepeat,
                        java.lang.String eventDetails)
        Will add an event if it is not a duplicate and will return boolean whether or not the action can be performed. Will not add an event if it overlaps with an activity that is already in the schedule.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the event
        meetingDays - the days the event will meet
        startTime - the time the event will start
        endTime - the time the event will end
        weeklyRepeat - the number of times an event will repeat in a month
        eventDetails - Details about the event
        Returns:
        boolean if an event can be added or not
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the event is a duplicate and is already in schedule
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the event overlaps with the days and time of another already scheduled activity

      • removeActivity

        public boolean removeActivity(int idx)
        Removes a course from the student's schedule if it exists in the schedule and true will be returned. If not then nothing will be removed and false will be returned.
        Parameters:
        idx - TODO
        Returns:
        boolean of if the course can or cannot be removed

      • resetSchedule

        public void resetSchedule()
        resets a student's schedule by setting the students schedule equal to an empty arrayList

      • getCourseCatalog

        public java.lang.String[][] getCourseCatalog()
        This returns a 2D array of the courses within the catalog
        Returns:
        String[][] a 2D representation of the courses in the catalog

      • getScheduledActivities

        public java.lang.String[][] getScheduledActivities()
        This returns a 2D array of the courses within the student's schedule
        Returns:
        String[][] a 2D representation of the courses in the schedule

      • getFullScheduledActivities

        public java.lang.String[][] getFullScheduledActivities()
        This returns a 2D array of the courses within the students scheduled courses. This returns a complete set of information i.e. name, title, section, credits, instructorid and meetingdays.
        Returns:
        String[][] a 2D representation of the courses in the catalog

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        This returns the title of the schedule
        Returns:
        the title

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        This sets the title to anything other than 'null'
        Parameters:
        title - the title to set

      • exportSchedule

        public void exportSchedule(java.lang.String fileName)
        This exports the current schedule to a new file
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file into which to store the student's schedule
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file cannot be saved.
